label: Description
value: Crib quilt of white cotton with appliquéd design of red flowers and a green vine in printed cottons. Edged with the same green printed cotton. Quilted in the trapunto style, with heavily padded hearts and ferns.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: appliquéd plain and roller-printed fabrics, quilted

label: Description
value: Oval brooch of carved shell mounted to gold frame. Design shows female figure carved in relief.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. L. H. Domke

label: Description
value: Rectangular wallet, stamped leather, in elaborate swirling lines making up undecipherable initials on one side and the words NEW YORK on the other side.

label: Provenance
value: See property file in registrar's department

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Anonymous Donor in memory of Serbella Moores
Stage Design: Ringstadten Castle, for the Last Scene of Undine

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. A large castle is seen on a promentory in a lake, approached by a fortified bridge. A barren mountain in the backgrond. Below, artists' and publisher's names and the title: "BURG RINGSTADTEN / in der letzten Scene der Oper Undine"

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch
Rear View of the First Gilded Carriage

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The rear view with a scale, title above, and below, a description and design for variations on the sides and front of the carriage. The carriage was designed for the entrance of His Excellency the Duke d'Ossuna into Utrecht, 1713. On the roof, three putti support a crown, an urn at either side. Below, in a curtained opening, a seated woman, a lion and cornucopia at her feet.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in black ink on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch
Act 5, Scene 1, for Il Pomo d'Oro

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. A single figure is seen in the center front of the stage. Houses and gardens at either side, and a broad vista in the center. Jupiter and Juno on a cloud. Below, artists' names.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in black ink on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch
Stage Set for Il Trionfo della Pietà

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. A rocky landscape opens to the sea, with the setting sun. Castles at either side, with figures gesticulating from the ramparts. On a cloud in the center, the figure of "Plenty." Banners from the casltes, inscribed: "PIACE SE LICE" and "LICE SE PIACE." Artists' names below.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in black ink on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch
Stage Design: Jerusalem and Mount Zion, for Athalia

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. A broad terrace with statues of decked-out bulls bordered by Egyptian palaces. In the background, a fortress with square towers on a hill. Below, artists' and publisher's names and title: "AUSSICHT AUF DIE STADT JERUSALEM UND DIE BURG SION / in der Oper Athalia von Poissl"

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. A man in Turkish robes, standing, facing frontally and holding a shield which is inscribed with the title, author, and the name of the Grand Duke of Tuscany, to whom the play, "Il Solimano" is dedicated. The man represents Soliman the First. Trophies around him, and battle scenes. The Medici arms above. Lower left: "Fa. in aqua Forte."

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. An engraving of the scenery (the same for the 5 acts) and the actors in the first act. The set depicts an Italian town in perspective, as the village of Alep in Syria. Troops stand at the corners of the streets, and the main characters, Soliman, Acmat, and Rus are center. the artist's name, lower right center.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving with black ink on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch
Second Intermezzo, for La Liberazione di Tirenno e. D'Arnea

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. A set design: the second intermezzo of three for a theatrical work by Andrea Salvadori, "La Liberzione di Tirenno, e. D'Arnea." This one is labelled "Hell arming itself for the vengence fo Circe against Tyrene." A street lined with high buildings and ruins, a sea beyond, flames and demons scattered everywhere. Below, title and artists' name.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving with black ink on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch
Catafalque of Louis Boucherat, Second State, St. Gervais, Paris

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. The catafalque is shown on a high platform, with a balduchin over it. Crowds of mourners to left and right. Below, artists' names.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in black ink on paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. William G. Fitch
Certificate of Authorization for the Title of "Von" for Johann Ferdinand Richter

label: Description
value: Consists of seventeen pages of text, including illumination of arms, giving a brief history of Richter (he joined the Austrian army in 1754; saw service 1757-63).  Signed by Emperor Josef and counter-signed by Tobias Philip, Freiher von Coblentz.  Imperial seal case is attached by a silk cord to the book.  Past-paper book papers used as end papers.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor over engraving on vellum, bound in velvet-covered boards with imperial seal in brass case

label: Dimensions
value: (closed): 37 x 33 cm (14 9/16 in. x 13 in.) (diam. of case): 14.9 cm (5 7/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: 1962: acquired by Museum (from James J. Kane)

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Erskine Hewitt
Chef des Indiens (Indian Chief), plate 8 from the series Caravanne du Sultan a la Mecque (Caravan of a Sultan Going to Mecca)

label: Description
value: Dark-skinned man with mustache leans against low wall. Both hands at belt, from which hangs long curved sword. He faces frontally, and wears stiff striped turban with fur, feathers, and pearls.

label: Provenance
value: 1962: acquired by Museum (from James J. Kane)

Sultane Reine (The Queen Sultana), plate 29 from Caravanne du Sultan à la Mecque (The Sultan's Caravan to Mecca)

label: Description
value: Youth in costume of highest ranking and most richly dressed woman in Turkish court. He wears ermine-trimmed robes, high jeweled and feathered turban, necklace and jeweled tasseled belt. Shown facing frontally, landscape beyond.

Stage Design: Act II, for the Chushingura

label: Description
value: Horizontal format. A stage set shows the interior of a house, with the figure of a samurai and kneeling woman. In the right middle distance, a woman kneels behind a painted screen. Garden with two figures on a porch, left background. Title, upper right. Border composed of motifs of actors' seals (tomo-e crests).

label: Description
value: A large frame on a wall consisting of scrolls, putti, a lion, a mascaron, fruit and flower festoons and a lobster. Inside the frame is a large tureen with lion's feet and a woman's face at center. Below the frame, there are smaller tureens at left and right; at center a fountain in the shape of an urn with two putti playing.

Book Endpaper Design: Two Paisley Bands

label: Description
value: Two identical bands of stylized paisley motifs. The teardrop-shaped forms contain elaborate orange and red patterns incorporating leaves and black dots and are positioned against a blue background. Between these two large bands are smaller cream, orange, and red decorated strips; one consists of black dots, an orange background, and red triangle-like forms, and the other contains red and orange flowers against a cream background. A strip containing black horizontal lines appears in the middle of the composition.

label: Provenance
value: Randolph Gunter; James J. Kane, New York, NY; 1962: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. J.G.K. Duer

value: Black oilcloth table cover printed in dull red. Center has birds drinking from a fountain surrounded by a flower wreath. Border has flowers, a cup and a fountain.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on oil cloth
